meanings.definition: The act of accusing or charging someone with a crime.
meanings.sent1: The incriminations against the suspect were based on solid evidence.
meanings.sent2: The detective found incriminations that pointed towards the culprit.
meanings.sent3: The incriminations in the courtroom made everyone gasp.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held incriminations that spoke louder than words.
meanings.sent5: The incriminations in the case were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.

meanings.definition: Statements or actions that suggest someone is guilty of wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The incriminations from the witness were crucial in solving the case.
meanings.sent2: His nervous behavior only added to the incriminations against him.
meanings.sent3: The incriminations in the movie plot kept the audience guessing until the end.
meanings.sent4: The incriminations in her tone made it clear she knew more than she was letting on.
meanings.sent5: The incriminations in the letter revealed the truth behind the mystery.
